definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Taking the ball away from someone on the other team is called stealing the ball.
sentences.chinese: 把球從對方球隊之某人腳下截得叫做斷球。

sentences.english: Milla stole the ball from Higuita and shot into the empty nets.
sentences.chinese: 米拉從伊基塔腳下斷球，將球射入空門。

sentences.english: Taking the ball away from someone on the other team is titled stealing the ball.
sentences.chinese: 把球從對方球隊的某人腳下截得叫做斷球。

definition: hat trick (when one player scores three goals)
to mess sth up/to screw up
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
combined assault/to mount a joint attack
